headline.main: Marines in Afghanistan's South, Riots in North, Invitations in Michigan
headline.kicker: A NATION CHALLENGED -- AN OVERVIEW: NOV. 26, 2001

lead_paragraph: The arrival of United States marines at a desert base near the Taliban stronghold of Kandahar effectively opened a southern front in the Afghan war, distinct in purpose and means from the battle fronts north of the Hindu Kush mountains. A NEW PLAN -- Basically, the plan in the north was for Americans to supply the air power while the militias of the Northern Alliance did most of the mopping up on the ground. In the south, where the Americans have no native force to work with, the marines and commandos were to work the land, scouring the roads and caves for fleeing leaders of the Taliban and Al Qaeda.
abstract: Overview of developments on November 26 in US war against terrorism (M)
